text: often when I try to explain why people
with autism can actually be superior at
certain jobs I told them is that's
because they think outside of the box
because they don't see any box today I'm
working on a program called tantastic
which gives me by company called
Launchpad toys and what it is is a
program to create your own animated
video the special skill is a vocational
program for people with autism the
numbers that you see range from 80 to 90
percent of the people on the spectrum
being unemployed I see it was a total
waste to society it's there is a huge
potential human potential human capital
that we are just throwing away because
someone doesn't look you in the eye or
isn't smiling all the time it's like
here you can choose what music you want
I like doing this kind of work because
it has lots of attention to detail
and it also has a lot of the
similarities in what you do for lots of
different programs which for me I
personally like the routine I've learned
that what I have a routine in my life
that my life goes a lot smoother
I'll admit about this time last year I
thought I'd hit rock bottom I was out of
college for nearly four years and still
had little the chauffeur my education
I've only been a full-time employee
since January but I started in October
as an intern I just wished that
companies would more open up to the idea
that having autistic employees isn't a
liability it can be quite an asset
anyone out there with autism who thinks
they don't have hope anymore
or thinks they don't have a chance in
the workplace they should reconsider and
know that it's been done my whole family
has been real positive because I'm
finally able to get to the workplace and
I'm able to start getting work done and
it's a really big step for me especially
because this is the type of place which
is going is helping me to learn how to
be able to eventually get my own job
somewhere else and being able to succeed
